lines.text: At last, after two thousand years of research, the illudium Q-36 explosive space modulator. At last...
Where's the kaboom? There was supposed to be an earth-shattering kaboom!
[after the rocket has left the Earth]
The sun ain't even up. No wonder I'm so sleep-y?
[a shooting star passes right past Bugs]
YIKES! What was that?
[a satellite knocks Bugs off the rocket, and Bugs is hanging on for dear life]
Well, ask a silly question...
Gads what a night. I'll never mix radish juice and carrot juice again.
Something tells me I should've stood in bed.
Run for the hills folks, or you'll be up to your armpits in Martians.
[Bugs has disposed of the green Martians]
Oh dear. Now I shall have to create more Martians.
Oh goody! My illudium Q-36 explosive space modulator.
[Kaboom]
Well, back to the old drawing board.
Hey where the heck am I anyway? Well wherever it is, I don't like it and I'm getting out of here.

[to Marvin]
Eh, pardon me, Doc, but could you rent me a U-drive-'em flying saucer? I gotta get back to the Earth.
The Earth? Oh, the Earth will be gone in just a few seconds.

[walking away]
Oh, well, don't bother, then. No point in wasting money on a flying saucer when the Earth's not gonna...
[Bugs stops suddenly with a shock and comes back to Marvin, who is trying to light the fuse of the space modulator]
Eh, pardon me again, Doc, but, uh, just what did you mean by that crack about the Earth being gone?
Oh, I'm going to blow it up; it obstructs my view of Venus.
It does? That's a shame.
[Bugs gets a terrified look and craftily defuses the modulator and takes it away]
[Marvin notices that his space modulator is missing and he discovers Bugs running off with it]
The illudium Q-36 explosive space modulator! That creature has stolen the space modulator!
I hope this Martian hot-rod gets at least a million miles to the gallon. The Earth ain't just across the street.
